Instruction: Cook onion in olive oil until translucent for about 10 minutes. Add garlic and parsley. Cook until onions start to brown. Remove from heat and let cool.
Mix together bread crumbs, grated Romano cheese, raisins, pine nuts, and black pepper in a medium bowl.

Roll steak flat to about 1/2-inch thickness with a moistened mallet or the side of a cleaver. Spread the onion mixture evenly over the meat, leaving a 1-inch border around the edges. Sprinkle the bread crumb mixture in a uniform layer, and drizzle with 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Roll the steak up starting from the narrow end and secure tightly with kitchen twine.

Brown the steak on all sides in the remaining olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Pour in the spaghetti sauce, reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for about 2 hours until the steak is tender.
